definition: to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: He is antipathetic to new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他天生就封新觀念起反感。

sentences.english: Is she disgusted that he would so soon betray Anna?
sentences.chinese: 她是否爲他對安娜如此之快的背叛感到反感？

sentences.english: Indeed, we have a natural repugnance to so doing.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，我們有一個天然的反感，以這樣做。

sentences.english: The violent scenes filled the audience with revulsion.
sentences.chinese: 這些暴力的場面使觀衆很反感。

sentences.english: He shut his comlink in disgust.
sentences.chinese: 杜庫反感地關閉通訊器。

sentences.english: To feel or express strong unwillingness or repugnance .
sentences.chinese: 她對這不受歡迎的建議感到反感。

sentences.english: Was I too stupid?Frustrates the feeling is a repugnant thing.
sentences.chinese: 是我太愚蠢了麼？情緒沮喪是一件很反感的事情呢。

sentences.english: Why on the contrary do those so-called multifunctional home appliances make person antipathetic?
sentences.chinese: 那些所謂的多功能家電爲什麼反而使人反感？

sentences.english: Perelman's aversion to public spectacle and to riches is mystifying to many.
sentences.chinese: 佩雷爾曼對公衆活動和財富的反感令許多人不解。

sentences.english: Picture the person in a repellent fashion.
sentences.chinese: 把那個人想象成一個令你反感的人。

sentences.english: He seemed positively scandalized at my suggestion.
sentences.chinese: 我的設想似乎引起他極大的反感。

sentences.english: Instead of resisting the accounting work, I decided to see it as a training exercise.
sentences.chinese: 與其反感會計工作，我決定視它爲一個訓練。

sentences.english: And that is why the Jews were scandalized by the cross.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼猶太人對十字架反感。

sentences.english: But it is the laboratory-made clones that upset people.
sentences.chinese: 讓人反感的是實驗室裏進行的無性繁殖。

sentences.english: There was an instinctive antipathy betweeen the two…
sentences.chinese: 在這兩人中有一種天生的反感存在。

definition: bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
to reject/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to repel
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
